name: indivisibility
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
the fact that something is not able to be separated from something else or into different parts: The country’s constitution guarantees from the first line the unity and indivisibility of the state. Both men bring the Japanese belief in the indivisibility of art and craft to their work. See
indivisible
More examplesFewer examplesTheir position emphasizes the indivisibility of the four freedoms - free movement of goods, services, capital, and labour - that underpin the European single market. As a composer, he was an inspiring example of the interconnectedness and total indivisibility of music and political reality, art and life.The opening song is about the indivisibility of a loving union.
